item.title: PoC Exploit Published for Critical Ivanti EPM Vulnerabilities
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Proof-of-concept (PoC) code and technical details on four critical-severity Ivanti EPM vulnerabilities are now available.

The post PoC Exploit Published for Critical Ivanti EPM Vulnerabilities appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Industry Moves for the week of February 17, 2025 - SecurityWeek
item.description: Explore industry moves and significant changes in the industry for the week of February 17, 2025. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and shifts.

item.title: US Military Health Provider HNFS Pays $11M in Settlement Over Cybersecurity Failures
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
US military health benefits program administrator HNFS to pay $11 million in settlement over its false claims of cybersecurity compliance.

The post US Military Health Provider HNFS Pays $11M in Settlement Over Cybersecurity Failures appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Microsoft Patches Exploited Power Pages Vulnerability
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Microsoft has patched CVE-2025-24989, a Power Pages privilege escalation vulnerability that has been exploited in attacks.

The post Microsoft Patches Exploited Power Pages Vulnerability appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: How Hackers Manipulate Agentic AI with Prompt Engineering
item.dc:creator: Etay Maor
item.description:
Organizations adopting the transformative nature of agentic AI are urged to take heed of prompt engineering tactics being practiced by threat actors.

The post How Hackers Manipulate Agentic AI with Prompt Engineering appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: CISO Conversations: Kevin Winter at Deloitte and Richard Marcus at AuditBoard
item.dc:creator: Kevin Townsend
item.description:
SecurityWeek speaks with Kevin Winter, Global CISO at Deloitte, and Richard Marcus, CISO at AuditBoard.

The post CISO Conversations: Kevin Winter at Deloitte and Richard Marcus at AuditBoard appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Blockaid Raises $50 Million to Secure Blockchain Applications
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Blockaid raises $50 million in Series B funding to scale operations to meet demand for its blockchain application security platform.

The post Blockaid Raises $50 Million to Secure Blockchain Applications appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: OpenSSH Patches Vulnerabilities Allowing MitM, DoS Attacks
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The latest OpenSSH update patches two vulnerabilities, including one that enabled MitM attacks with no user interaction.

The post OpenSSH Patches Vulnerabilities Allowing MitM, DoS Attacks appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: VC Firm Insight Partners Hacked
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Venture capital firm Insight Partners has been targeted in a cyberattack that involved unauthorized access to its information systems.

The post VC Firm Insight Partners Hacked appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Chrome 133, Firefox 135 Updates Patch High-Severity Vulnerabilities
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Google and Mozilla resolve high-severity memory safety vulnerabilities with the latest Chrome and Firefox security updates.

The post Chrome 133, Firefox 135 Updates Patch High-Severity Vulnerabilities appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: New FrigidStealer macOS Malware Distributed as Fake Browser Update
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
A recently identified macOS infostealer named FrigidStealer has been distributed through a compromised website, as a fake browser update.

The post New FrigidStealer macOS Malware Distributed as Fake Browser Update appeared first on SecurityWeek.
